The genesis of the attached draft Bill ie to he found in questions which arose as to the necessity for continuing the Sheriff Court House at Inveraray, Argyllshire. This Court House is available for sittings both . of the High Court of Justiciary on Circuit and of the Sheriff Court, cut no civil or criminal business has been transacted in the Sheriff Court since 1919, and the last sitting of the High Court there was in 1908. In these circumstances there appeared to be no sufficient reason for the continuance of the Court House which involved the payment of considerable maintenance expenses by Exchequer. The Secretary for Scotland can by Order provide for the" discontinuance.of the Sheriff Court but the High Court are bound by.statute to arrange for the holding of Circuit Courts at Inveraray if there are any case:; and accordingly, it is impossible to discontinue the Court Houoe without amendment of the statute referred to. The possibility of legislation was, therefore, considered and the conclusion reached was th-'t it would.be desirable," if any legislation were introduced, to take the opportunity of consolidating and improving existing enactments relating to the holding of Circuit Courts of Justiciary. The Court of Justiciary under this Dill will have more or less'complete freedom in fixing the times and places of Circuit Courts and thsre will be no statutory impediment tO the discontinuance of the Court House at Inveraray.: Opportunity has at the same time been taken to make certain amendments in the criminal procedure code designed to facilitate and expedite proceedings. The Bill, which haa been adjusted with the authorities of the Justiciary Court and has the approval of the Treasury, ehouM prove non-contentioua, and in these circumstances I aek authority to introduce it, on the : , understanding that time will not be sought to press it through Parliament this Session should any serious opposition arise^ It is possible that objection will be taken, on grounds of sentiment and long usage, to the abolition of the Circuit Court at Inveraray. * T^K.
